data.title: Graham A Giddy Funeral Homes
data.meta_description: Welcome to the Graham A. Giddy Funeral Homes website. Whether you would like to learn more about planning a funeral or grief support, or you're just looking for general information on funeral arrangements, please feel free to look around. If you have any questions, we're available by phone, by email or in person.
data.text:
MISSION STATEMENT

To provide the highest standard of professional excellence and compassionate care to the families and friends of our communities in first class facilities.

To provide a professional staff of caring individuals sensitive to people of all faiths, traditions and life styles, regardless of the type of service chosen.

To provide responsible care not only throughout the funeral process, but ongoing support to families to begin healing and new beginnings after the service is over.

UPDATED APRIL 1, 2022

WELCOME TO THE GRAHAM A. GIDDY FUNERAL HOME.

Dear neighbours and friends.

Our priority is to assist families in need and help them at times of change. Whether you came to our site for information about an upcoming service or to make arrangements for one. We hope the information you find here will be helpful.

FUNERAL SERVICES, VISITATION AND RECEPTIONS;

We are able to offer full services to our families, including food and beverage service and pre arrangement appointments. Ontario's mask mandate has been lifted as well, but some families may still choose to ask you to wear a mask.

CLOSINGS ANNOUNCEMENT (November 10, 2023)

"With deep sadness, we regret to announce the closing of both the Elora and Waterloo Chapels; no new business will be conducted at these locations going forward.

The Fergus Chapel will seamlessly continue to serve with respect and compassion and is honoured to continue to serve families, friends, and the community at large well into the future.

We wish to offer our heartfelt thanks to all the families and friends we have served over many years throughout Wellington County & Waterloo Region. Your patronage is greatly appreciated."
